title: Redesign UI with Premium Airline Visual Style (Qatar Airways-inspired)

requirements.text: Refine the overall visual design to more closely reflect the premium airline aesthetic of carriers like Qatar Airways. This includes: increasing section vertical padding and whitespace for a more spacious, luxurious feel; upgrading typography weight and letter-spacing on headings for an upscale editorial look; adding subtle warm undertones (e.g., soft champagne/gold accent alongside the existing primary blue) to borders, dividers, or section separators to evoke premium airline branding; ensuring all cards use consistent refined box shadows and slightly increased border-radius; and polishing the hero section overlay, fonts, and layout to feel on par with a premium airline homepage hero.

quotes: Build a clean, elegant, and easy-to-understand web interface that looks like a real airport-grade application.
The interface should feel calm, premium, and trustworthy.
Subtle shadows and soft depth effects

acceptanceCriteria: Sections have generous vertical padding (min 96px top/bottom) giving a spacious, airy feel
Headings use refined letter-spacing and font-weight consistent with premium airline branding
A subtle gold/champagne accent color is applied to decorative dividers or section separators
All cards share consistent box-shadow depth and border-radius values
The hero section visually competes in quality with a premium airline homepage banner

requirements.text: Redesign the top navigation bar to match the premium airline style: use a slim, elegant bar with generous horizontal padding; display the logo/brand name using a refined serif or semi-bold sans-serif font; apply a thin bottom border in a subtle gold or light grey tone; ensure nav links use slightly spaced uppercase or small-caps styling with a clean underline or dot indicator on the active link; and remove any visual clutter so only the four links ('Live Entry', 'Member Management', 'Entry Logs', 'Security & System Status') are present.

quotes: Create a simple top navigation bar containing ONLY: Live Entry, Member Management, Entry Logs, Security & System Status
Do NOT add extra buttons such as booking, offers, flights, login, or travel-related features.

acceptanceCriteria: Navbar contains exactly four navigation links with no additional buttons
Nav links are styled with refined uppercase or spaced lettering
Active nav link is clearly indicated with an underline or dot accent
Navbar has a thin decorative bottom border and generous horizontal padding
No booking, login, travel, or unrelated links are present

requirements.text: Polish the hero section (IntroductionSection) to more closely resemble a premium airline homepage hero: ensure the lounge background image fills the full viewport height with a refined gradient overlay (dark at bottom, lighter at top) rather than a flat overlay; position the headline 'Premium Lounge AI – Face Recognition Entry System' in large, bold, elegant typography (min 3.5rem on desktop); add a short professional tagline below it; include one clean call-to-action button with airline-style outline or solid styling; and add a subtle animated scroll-down chevron at the bottom center.

quotes: Title: 'Premium Lounge AI – Face Recognition Entry System'

acceptanceCriteria: Hero section fills full viewport height with the lounge background image
A gradient overlay is used (not a flat semi-transparent layer)
Headline font size is at least 3.5rem on desktop
A professional tagline is displayed below the headline
A scroll-down chevron animation is visible at the bottom center of the hero

requirements.text: Improve the scroll-driven workflow sections (Face Detection, AI Processing, Verification Result, Access Authorization) to feel like a guided premium product walkthrough: add section labels/eyebrow text (e.g., 'STAGE 01 — FACE DETECTION') in small caps or uppercase tracking above each section heading; ensure consistent section structure with a left-aligned or centered headline, a short descriptor paragraph, and the main content block below; apply entrance animations (fade-in + subtle upward slide) with staggered delays so content elements within each section animate in sequence rather than all at once.

quotes: Scrolling should smoothly reveal sections similar to a premium airline homepage.
The website should look like a real airport software system inspired by premium airline websites

acceptanceCriteria: Each workflow section has an eyebrow/stage label (e.g., 'STAGE 01 — FACE DETECTION') above the section title
Section headings and descriptor paragraphs are consistently structured across all five sections
Entrance animations use staggered delays so elements animate in sequence within each section
Animations are smooth and minimal — no excessive bouncing or heavy effects
All five workflow sections feel cohesive and part of a unified guided walkthrough

constraints: Do not alter immutable frontend paths: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui
Navigation bar must contain only the four existing links: Live Entry, Member Management, Entry Logs, Security & System Status — no additional navigation items
Do not add booking, travel, flight, login, or unrelated airline features
All existing mock data and page functionality must be preserved
nonGoals: Adding real face recognition or AI backend functionality
Adding new navigation pages beyond the existing four
Implementing authentication or user login flows

required: Photorealistic premium airport lounge interior with warm lighting, plush seating, large windows with runway view, and a calm upscale atmosphere (lounge-hero.dim_1920x1080.jpg)
